title: Ticket #1299: scheduler jobs can start during schedd shutdown
description:
When in shutdown mode, the schedd still calls StartLocalJobs() in the poorly named schedd houskeeping function scheduler::timeout(). This allows scheduler universe jobs to start up, which can lead to a cycle of killing and restarting scheduler jobs until the graceful shutdown time finally expires.

Local universe jobs get queued to start but the runnable job queue is not processed while in shutdown mode, so they don't actually run.

To reproduce, submit 20 scheduler universe jobs that sleep for an hour. Set SCHEDD_INTERVAL=5. Run condor_off -schedd. Rather than exiting within ~20 seconds, the schedd keeps killing and restarting the scheduler jobs until the graceful shutdown time expires.
